column4: anyone tried the new gnome shell on lucid ?  or know much of anything about it to know if its worth a install ?
gnome-shell is a little rough around the edges still, but it's "cool".  It's certainly not ready to replace Gnome, but neat to see.
functionally cool or hip cool ?
hip cool it's mainly just eye candy
your question is really OT for this channel, but i don't have any recommendations on hosting or where to go for hosting suggestions.  best of luck though.
does conky % fork the process immediately to the background ?
add it to System / Preferences / Startup Applications
could you give me a one liner with a slight sleep command, i feel without a sleep command, minimal wait integer, thati'll really help me out
i don't have my conky/ubuntu theme setup right now so can't give you my example :(  - but just adding the appropriate conky run line to Startup Applications has always worked fine for me.
excuse me, conky &
don't use the % at the end (in the system / preferences / startup apps)
did you run update-grub after updating the file?
/var/cache/aprt/archives
/var/cache/apt/archives sorry typo
i highly doubt you can use AWN with gnome-shell.
i highly doubt you can use conky with gnome-shell.
i guess i was wrong...  thanks B45h_V|
don't get too used to gnome-shell, looks like it's being removed from 11.04 due to some bug/issue
i'm just feeling experimental.  the LTS will still be gnome
Gnome is being replaced by Unity in 11.04 (but there is still an option to use "classic"), but that's a separate issue from gnome-shell (personally i think gnome-shell is very cool, but still buggy)
